intro: Centaurium ameghinoi, commonly known as the Andean centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
